intro: Diodia teres var. hirsutior, commonly known as roughleaf diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are typically hairy or rough to the touch, giving it the "hirsutior" variety name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
